title: Encoding not properly applied, leading to misaligned labels in importing pre-labelled data
body: How to reproduce the behaviour --------- 1. Unzip and import the attached file into a new sequence labelling project with `latin_1` encoding and `data` as the Column Data: [output_lines_single_doc.jsonl.zip](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/files/9096871/output_lines_single_doc.jsonl.zip) 2. Notice that the labels are misaligned. This screenshot corresponds with the label `[258, 269, "Drug Relevant"]` in the `jsonl` file: 3. Copy the text in the `data` field of the JSONL file into a separate text file 4. Write a simple Python program and run it ``` with open('', 'r', encoding='latin-1') as f: print("latin-1") print(f.read()[258: 269]) with open('', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: print("utf-8") print(f.read()[258: 269]) ``` 5. Notice that the output of `latin-1` encoding is correct: `gemcitabine` 6. Notice that the output of `utf-8` encoding is incorrect, and is the same as what is shown in Doccano: `mcitabine (` Your Environment --------- * Operating System: MacOS Monterey 12.4 for local script, Ubuntu 18.04 for Doccano * Python Version Used: 3.9 * When you install doccano: * How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Docker
